newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel- crude takes edge off prices.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel- crude takes edge off prices.

text.p: NWE straight-run fuel oil took a back seat on Friday as the market focused on the stronger cracked market. Weaker crude capped any moves upwards.
A Zawia cargo was understood to be offered around $128 cif NWE, which appeared reasonable set against home low sulphur straight-run which was put in a range of $124-126 fob NWE.

High sulphur straight-run was steady with avails of Russian material noticeably stronger than on the cracked sector. Brokers said straight-run had not surged in the same manner. They said E-4s would take around formula +$4-4.50. -- Matthew Jones, London Newsroom, +44 171 542 8980
